document.masterDocTitle: Synopsis of the shore bugs of China (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Leptopodomorpha: Saldidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution in China : Fujian , Hebei , Heilongjiang , Henan , Hubei (Chen 1987), Guangdong (Vinokurov 2015), Guizhou ( Chen & Lindskog 1994 ), Qinghai , Sichuang, Yunnan (Chen 1987). New record for Jiangxi Province .

Additional material: Jiangxi :
23-29.iv.2011
, Jinggangshan Mts. , Baiyinhu Village , env. (stream valley; wet rock; at light) 26˚36.8’N, 114˚11.1’E,
800m
, F. Fikáček & J. Hájek leg
;
[MF01] China : Sichuang : Emeishan Mt. ,
8- 9.VI.2014
, Leidongping ,
2420m
, 29˚32’25”N, 103˚19’52”E; (induvidually, on vegetation floating Rosa , mixed forest, J. Hájek , J. Růžička & M. Tkoč leg.

Notes .
Saldula recticollis
was described from Hokkaido , Japan by Horváth (1899) who assigned this species to the genus
Salda
. The holotype is deposited in the Entomological Institute of the Hokkaido University, Sapporo, Japan . This species is widely distributed from north ( Hokkaido ) to south (Ryukyu archipalago) in Japan ( Hayashi & Miyamoto 2005 ). Drake & Maa (1954) described
Saldula fukiena
from Fujian Province , SE China . The holotype is deposited in the Drake Collection in the United States National Museum of Natural History. In addition, Vinokurov (1981) described
Saldula arsenjevi
from the southern Far East. The holotype is deposited in the Zoological Institute, Russian Academy of Sciences ( St. Petersburg ). The latter two species were synomized by Lindskog (1995) after examining the type series and specimens from Nankai University (
Tianjin
, China ). We have also examined the specimens seen by Lindskog and agree with the synonymy.

(
